meanings.sent1: I need to recalibrate the scale to make sure it shows the correct weight.
meanings.sent2: It is important to recalibrate the compass before going on a hike.
meanings.sent3: Trying to recalibrate my watch while wearing gloves was a hilarious struggle.
meanings.sent4: After the power outage, I had to recalibrate my clock to get back on schedule.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to recalibrate the engine to make the car run smoothly again.

meanings.definition: Make small changes to improve accuracy or performance.
meanings.sent1: To improve the recipe, we must recalibrate the amount of salt used.
meanings.sent2: The technician will recalibrate the machine to ensure it operates efficiently.
meanings.sent3: I had to recalibrate my aim in the game to hit the target accurately.
meanings.sent4: She decided to recalibrate her study schedule for better productivity.
meanings.sent5: The coach had to recalibrate the team's strategy to win the match.
